title: Textile, ca. 1840
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: roller printed on  plain weave
inscribed:
"qui dort dine" under scene of soldiers stealing a chop from a sleeping Chinese person
"tiens ferme" (hold tight) under a scene of soldiers holding a pig by the tail
"petits petits" under a scene of soldiers trying to lure a chicken from its coop so they can kill it
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 129.5 x 109 cm (51 x 42 15/16 in.)
description: Four scenes - three captioned in French - in a diamond grid of leaves in purple and yellow. showing soldiers taking liberties with the countryside.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, ca. 1840.
ca. 1840. Medium: cotton
Technique: roller printed on  plain weave. Bequest of Elinor Merrell. 1995-50-366.
